column5: HOUSTON Valero Energy Corp remained the top U.S. refiner by capacity in the United States  according to an annual report on the nation's refineries issued by the U.S. Energy Information Administration on Monday.

column4: Wells Fargo fined by SEC over investment sales misconduct
column5: Wells Fargo & Co  will pay more than $5.1 million to settle U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission charges it improperly pushed retail customers to actively trade complex investments in order to generate higher fees.

column4: UPDATE 1-Wells Fargo fined by SEC over investment sales misconduct
column5: June 25 Wells Fargo & Co will pay more than $5.1 million to settle U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission charges it improperly pushed retail customers to actively trade complex investments in order to generate higher fees.

column4: Wells Fargo jumps into credit card rewards race
column5: June 25 Wells Fargo & Co introduced a new credit card rewards program on Monday  aiming to stand out against other benefit-heavy cards and gain more of a foothold in a market where it has lagged rivals.

column4: Shell  Exxon not to seek compensation for end of Groningen gas production: government
column5: AMSTERDAM Energy companies Royal Dutch Shell and Exxon Mobil will not submit a claim for missed revenue due to the Dutch government's decision to halt gas production at the Groningen field by 2030  the Dutch ministry of Economic Affairs said on Monday.

column4: REFILE-Shell gives go-ahead to third North Sea oil  gas project in 2018
column5: LONDON  June 25 Royal Dutch Shell said on Monday it will develop the Fram gas field in the North Sea  its third project approval in the ageing basin this year.

column4: UPDATE 1-Shell  Exxon not to seek compensation for end of Groningen gas production -govt

column4: Austria's Andritz buys U.S. firm Xerium for $833 million in cash
column5: VIENNA Austrian engineering group Andritz  has agreed to buy  Xerium Technologies   a supplier of paper industry products  in a $833 million cash deal that helps diversify its offerings.

column4: UPDATE 3-Austria's Andritz buys U.S. firm Xerium for $833 mln in cash
column5: * Andritz shares gain 5.7 percent  Xerium shares double (New throughout  adds details  comment from Barington Capital  updates share price)

column4: Deals of the day-Mergers and acquisitions
column5: June 25 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 1338 GMT on Monday:

column4: Austria's Andritz agrees to buy U.S. firm Xerium in $833 mln deal
column5: VIENNA  June 25 Andritz has agreed to buy U.S. machine industry company and supplier Xerium Technologies in a cash deal worth roughly $833 million  the Austrian engineering group said on Monday.

column4: Xerox says to lower dependency on Fujifilm  seek new vendors
column5: Xerox Corp said on Monday it would start sourcing products from new vendors to lower its dependency on Fujifilm Holdings Corp and may not renew its technology agreement with the 56-year-old joint venture Fuji Xerox.

column4: UPDATE 2-Xerox says to lower dependency on Fujifilm  seek new vendors
